security: The document is marked TOP SECRET. Sharing details of covert operations or agency employees like Gil Greenaway could compromise ongoing intelligence activities and the identities of individuals involved. Disclosing information about contact men, proprietary firms like Air America, or committees such as the Forty Committee and 54/12 Committee, would be detrimental to national security.
summary: This document is a transcript of a hearing from July 16, 1975, featuring testimony by L. Fletcher Prouty, discussing contacts within the White House and various agencies.
summary_one_paragraph: This is a transcript from a SSCIA hearing on July 16, 1975, featuring L. Fletcher Prouty's testimony regarding contacts within the White House and various agencies. Prouty details the nature of contacts in proprietary firms such as Air America and the Mullen Company, distinguishing between military and agency personnel, citing Gil Greenaway as an example of an Agency employee posing as a military contact in the Pentagon. He also discusses contacts related to the Forty Committee, 54/12 Committee, and a POW contact tied to the Mullen Company, prompted by questions from Schorr about contacts in the White House.
title: Transcript of Hearing Dated July 16, 1975
